project_description: A simple Flutter app that switches text between 'Cat' and 'Dog' with corresponding icons when clicked.
architecture_overview: The project uses the Cubit pattern for state management. The architecture is divided into screens, cubits, models, and widgets to ensure modularity and maintainability.

widgets.description: Displays the animal text and icon, and toggles the state when clicked.

cubits.description: Manages the state of the animal text, toggling between Cat and Dog.

models.description: Represents the state of the animal, either Cat or Dog.

dependencies.name: flutter_bloc

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> HomeScreen: open
HomeScreen -> AnimalCubit: listen
User -> AnimalTextWidget: click
AnimalTextWidget -> AnimalCubit: toggleAnimal
AnimalCubit -> Animal: updateState
Animal -> HomeScreen: newState
HomeScreen -> AnimalTextWidget: update
@enduml
state_management_flow: State is managed using the Cubit pattern. The AnimalCubit manages the state of the Animal model. When the AnimalTextWidget is clicked, it calls the toggleAnimal method of the AnimalCubit, which toggles the state between Cat and Dog. The new state is then reflected in the UI.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen (HomeScreen). Navigation is not required as the app is a simple one-screen application.
